snippet: Ohio must recognize the marriages of same-sex couples wed legally outside the state, a federal district judge in Cincinnati ruled Monday.
abstract: Federal Judge Timothy Black rules that Ohio must recognize the marriages of same-sex couples wed legally outside the state; stays his decision to give the sides time to argue whether it should be delayed until the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit hears an appeal.
lead_paragraph: Ohio must recognize the marriages of same-sex couples wed legally outside the state, a federal district judge in Cincinnati ruled Monday.

headline.main: Ohio: Federal Judge’s Ruling Favors Same-Sex Couples Wed Outside State
headline.print_headline: Ohio: Federal Judge’s Ruling Favors Same-Sex Couples Wed Outside State

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
